ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: How to apply to the IRB, how to correctly use SPSS, how to conduct qualitative and quantitative research and how to write lengthy research papers

Learned much more about how graduate research works (and psychology research in general), specifically about developmental research. Worked on all phases of developing, running, and analyzing data from a study.
I learned about all of the people, technologies and time that go into quality research.

I learned how to work in a psychology lab and engage with the research process. I learned how to interact with participants, code and enter data, and think critically about literature and research as a whole.

I really learned a lot about the research process and about psychology graduate student work. I had a great mentor and my experience working in the lab with her was invaluable. It really helped me figure out what I am looking for in a lab experience here at Yale.
Great way to learn how psych research works in practice.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: More of a check in with the psychology department throughout the semester.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: If you find a lab whose research really interests you, this is a wonderful course option.
I would definitely recommend independent research (esp. with Hedy Kober).

I recommend this course to anyone who is interested in research - it gives a very holistic representation of the research process. Be sure to choose a lab that is compatible with your interests, because then you'll have the best experience possible. I thoroughly enjoyed my experience at the lab I chose, and I learned a lot about the entire research process. Highly recommend!
I love directed resarch, it's a great way to get research experience during class time.
